name: Tower Hotel Waterford

reviews.text: Stayed here for 3 nights during the ploughing
reviews.title: Great Service

reviews.text: Hotel was booked out and still the service was excellent
reviews.title: LOVELY PLACE FOR SHORT STAY

reviews.text: Sam on reservations and Anthony (duty manager i think) couldnt do enough for us food was great.... well worth a visit :)
reviews.title: Our wonderful wedding day (",)

reviews.text: We stayed in this hotel prior to going to the ploughing championships in New ross. It was a cold evening when we arrived at a very busy hotel. We were delighted with the genuinely warm welcome! Reception was busy but they had plenty of staff on duty to cope and we got a nice comfortable room. We were a bit concerned that there might be outside noise due to the fully booked hotel but we didn't need worry! Everything was just right, down to the fab photography of the waterford coastline on display in the corridors and the bedrooms, definitely would encourage us to come back to the area to holiday ( if only the sun would shine more!) We got a fab dinner with a great deal for 4 courses and a bottle of wine. The only thing which I would say could do with improvement is that they should install air conditioning, the room was somewhat stuffy and a bit too chilly to open at night since the outside temp. was down to 5C the night we stayed! Would love to come back again for a weekend and explore Waterford.
reviews.title: Fantastic hotel

reviews.text: Hi, I would just like to say a huge thank you to the manager and staff of the Tower Hotel Waterford, My New Husband and I had both our civil ceremony and our reception at the Tower hotel on Friday 21st September 2012 and the day ran so smoothly from beginning to end the management and staff were so friendly and helpful they couldn't have done more for ourselves or our guests the food was exceptional and the rooms were beautiful they went above and beyond in our opinion!! Everyone had an absolute ball. I would recommend the hotel to anyone who is getting married in the future because it was a stress free and truely excellent day due to the efficiency of the staff and management. Thanks again for everything, Regards Kate and Glenn x
reviews.title: Pretty Poor

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel was clean, friendly staff and had great food. The room was of standard quality nothing exciting. The location of the hotel was excellent it was easy walking distance of anything we wanted to see. They had a singer the night we were there he was very good to listen to. I did notice after we had went to bed we could still here the performer in our room this was not late though he was finished at 12:30am we were just not up late so I noticed it.
reviews.title: Standard Room -Great Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel is near the new Waterford Crystal Factory, it is opposite a tower and beside the nice riverside area. The rooms are small especially the shower, likened to a cruise ship, although it was fully refurbished. It also has a cute television. Everything are so ordinary. Paid wifi, breakfast and the staff. The outside is nice area for photo shooting. It mainly caters to tour group like us.
reviews.title: Tower Hotel Waterford

reviews.text: Having stayed in this hotel a few times now and i have to say from de moment we arrive until we leave the hotel never fails to impress us,,,,staff are always on de ball and the hotel itself is excellent,,,de buffet breakfast has something for everyone even for de most critical of people ,,,, will def keep going back there :-)
reviews.title: Highly recommend :-)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were booked in here with our tour group. The best thing going for this rather faded lady is its proximity to Waterford Crystal. Beyond that, it is a tourist hotel in need of refurbishing and apparently catering mainly to tour groups. Room was small, smelled musty, but clean and comfortable. Decent breakfast. We'd probably look for alternatives if we return to Waterford, but it was adequate for our one-night stay.
reviews.title: CLose to Waterford Crystal

reviews.text: Visited the Tower Hotel with Family for Sunday Lunch. Lunch was excellent with half portions available if desired & plenty of seating available, the bar has a lovely view of the river & main street so plenty of activity to be seen. Also very child friendly & good childrens menu available. You can eat at your leisure on one rushing you to go. A very enjoyable experience.
reviews.title: Sunday Lunch

reviews.text: Hotel staff was good, but the rooms need serious attention. My room #237 had loose floor tiles in the bathroom, had to put the bath may down to avoid being cut by the tile. The tv set is outdated and the beds were extremely firm. Th location is ok across from the tower and not far from the Waterford Ctystal. Dont believe I would stay here again.
reviews.title: Not the best

reviews.text: Had a fantastic time at a Wedding at this hotel. The food was delish! The staff were fantastic and nothing was too much trouble. The waiting staff were young but were so professional they definitely have great careers ahead of them in the tourism industry. 5-Star treatment and service. I highly recommend this hotel.
reviews.title: Wedding

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My TripAdvisor reviews of 4-star hotels in Northern Ireland and the Republic document problems that would lower their rating if I were grading them. The Tower Hotel in Waterford is only three stars, but in my view it doesn’t live up to its rating, either. To begin, when we walked into our room the overhead lights were not on and no switch we threw would light them. So we called the desk and the woman said to put our card-key in the slot. We could’t find a slot so phoned again. Well, maybe there isn’t a slot in that room, just throw the switch. Lady, we’ve thrown all the switches. So she sent up a tech, who eventually decided that the bulbs in both overhead lights were burned out. About half or three-quarters of an hour later, he showed up with a ladder and bulbs. He managed to get one light working but the other one never was fixed during our stay.
reviews.title: What's in a Star?

reviews.text: The room had only four hangers, which didn’t even accommodate our wraps much less any clothing. The wi-fi password stamped on the card-key envelope was unreadable and we had to go to the desk to get a replacement. The door to the hall did not close automatically as in every other hotel and motel where we have ever stayed. The window opening was just a tilt allowing a crack, as in all Irish hotels, but this room was hot all night long so that we did not sleep well. I could continue, but it’s painful to read my notes so let’s end this torture.
reviews.title: DISAPPOINTING
Tower Hotel
reviews.text: We would be fairly regular visitor to Waterford and have stayed in several hotel there but The Tower was very disappointing. The room we had was very dingy, the beds were on castors and when we first went to sit on them we nearly landed on the floor as they moved when we went to sit down, bathroom was not the cleanest, toilet was very stained and there was a lot of dust on the the tops of the soap dispencers etc. the door did not lock properly, after requesting extra towels ( 2 people in the room but only 1 set of towels ) they were delivered that evening and on our return to the room we found the door still open due to the faulty lock and the staff not checking to make sure it was closed. there was a disco on one of the nights and luckily enough we came home at 2.30a.m. and the music finished about 15 minutes later, would have been very unpleasant if you wanted an early night!!!! we reported these problems but they were not dealth with, on leaving the hotel I filled in a comment card so they would be aware of the problems and that they could rectify them I got no response to this comment card (on completion the girl asked me for the card - I wonder was this card even handed in!!!) on the positive side the breakfast was lovely and the staff in the dining room were very nice. after always thinking that the Tower was THE place to stay I have now changed my opinion, unfortunately very a very disappointing stay

If you are traveling Ireland and staying at several places, this might be a great choice for you. It's a fine place to sleep and have breakfast, no other luxuries required. You can request a washcloth if you need one. It's located right across from Reginald's tower and a very short walking distance to the Waterford Crystal center.
reviews.title: Just what we needed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: In our experience, the hotel did not have our reservation from Hotels.com when we arrived, but they were able to honor it and not cause us worry.
reviews.title: Good location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here for 3 nights in July. Within walking distance of shops bars etc. Breakfast very good. Staff very friendly and helpful. Small car park, they allow double parking which causes problems. Beds are very hard so you don't get a comfortable sleep. Room far too hot and no way to turn down heat. Very noisy from the traffic even with the windows closed. Its okay for one night but that's all
reviews.title: Really nice stay!
Great wedding experience and stay
reviews.text: Stayed here midweek with the hubby to see a show that was on in the Theatre across the road. Have to say we had a great stay. Check in was fast & friendly. Room was nice- large & overlooking the water/ street. Bathroom was clean & roomy.

I booked the 'Wine & Dine' package. Food was excellent in the restaurant & wine was lovely. Staff were all lovely. Breakfast the following morning was great too. Lovely & fresh-buffet style.I was abit awkward & asked for poached eggs however this was no problem for them & they were delish!
